sen.j: 伏見宮貞康親王（ふしみのみや さだやすしんのう、天文 (元号)16年1月11日 （1547年2月1日） - 永禄11年4月15日 （1568年5月11日））は、戦国時代 の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadayasu (February 1, 1547 - May 11, 1568) was the Imperial family member of the period of Civil War.
Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadayasu (February 1, 1547 - May 11, 1568) was an Imperial family member during the Civil War period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayasu (February 1, 1547 - May 11, 1568) was an Imperial family member during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除戦国時代→the Sengoku period (period of warring states)

sen.e: He was Shikibukyo. (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonial)
He was Shikibukyo (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).
He was Shikibukyo (chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).
He was the eighth family head of Fushiminomiya family.
He was the eighth family head of Fushiminomiya family.
He was the eighth family head of Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮邦輔親王第二王子。
sen.e: He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kunisuke.
He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kunisuke.
He was the second Prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunisuke.
His mother was Sanenobe SAIONJI's daughter.
His mother was Sanenobe SAIONJI's daughter.
His mother was Sanenobu SAIONJI's daughter.

sen.j: 永禄6年（1563年）に親王宣下、元服。
sen.e: He received to title to become Imperial Prince in 1563 and had a coming-of-age ceremony.
He received th title of Imperial Prince in 1563 and had a coming-of-age ceremony.
He received the title of Imperial Prince in 1563 and had a coming-of-age ceremony.

sen.j: 墓地は京都市上京区の伏見宮墓地。
sen.e: Hie mausoleum was Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
His mausoleum is in Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
His mausoleum is in Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
